TopicTitle: Taking long time to switch from flight to map view? (1.7.3. modded)

Articles.Content:
I've noticed in my updated 1.7.3 install, that it takes much longer to switch from Flight mode into Map view.

Is this a known thing with any specific mods?

I've tested a stock 1.7.3 install (only mod is Hyperedit) versus my fully modded install, and the stock install is practically instantaneous. Modded install takes approx. 5 secs, which doesn't seem like a lot... but it's painfully obvious.

So most likely something is going on with my mod interactions and the Map View loading...

Thanks for any input, advice, or troubleshooting direction!

Here's my list from CKAN for reference:

Edited September 27, 2019 by scottadges
Five seconds you say? I envy you, in my late career with some 60+ mods and some 200 crafts, it takes about 40s to switch to a craft.

Yeah, switching crafts definitely causes some loading/lagging.

But this is more specifically when you are in one craft, then switching out to Map View (m) from Flight view, it freezes for a good 5 sec before loading the map (with planets, orbits, etc.).

I've been doing some baseline testing, and selectively pulling out graphics mods (my first thought to start) to see how it responds.

This is with the same craft in a clean save vs. my main save (obvs without other concurrent flights). It doesn't appear that the # of flights makes a difference, with those graphics mods removed.

I'll keep testing... 'cause I really don't want to play KSP without EVE or OPM...

UPDATES:

Test #1: Removing AVP/EVE, PlanetShine, Distant Object Enhancement, Kopernicus/OPM. Result: Load into Map view was acceptable (<1 sec)

Test #2: Adding back Kopernicus/OPM but leaving out AVP/EVE. Result: Same lag switching into Map view.

Test #3: Removing Kopernicus/OPM but including AVP/EVE. Result: Bingo! No lag switching into Map view.

So... I guess I'll have to investigate Kopernicus/OPM and see what's going on with that mod.

 

Edited September 27, 2019 by scottadges
I see what you mean now, yes. I had to remove Kopernicus some time ago due to issues with the BG surface features, but I don't remember any big lag switching between flight mode and map mode.

3 minutes ago, VoidSquid said:

I see what you mean now, yes. I had to remove Kopernicus some time ago due to issues with the BG surface features, but I don't remember any big lag switching between flight mode and map mode. 

Thanks, so far I haven't see that BG surface feature issue. But I haven't landed on any planets since I updated to KSP 1.7.3 so... I guess I have that to look forward to LOL

It seems other people are having the Map view / Flight freezing issue over in the Kopernicus thread. I posted there as well.

And we have awesome help! 

I posted this as an issue in the Kopernicus GitHub: https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/issues/382

And within just a few minutes, @DeltaDizzy replied back with a suggested fix. You can read his explanation at GitHub (about the OnDemandBiomes), but the fix was adding a custom config in GameData: 

@Kopernicus:FINAL
{
    %useOnDemandBiomes = false
}

I've tested this on my main savegame and it eliminated the freezing when switching between Flight and Map view! 

Thanks so much!

3 hours ago, scottadges said:

And we have awesome help! 

I posted this as an issue in the Kopernicus GitHub: https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/issues/382

And within just a few minutes, @DeltaDizzy replied back with a suggested fix. You can read his explanation at GitHub (about the OnDemandBiomes), but the fix was adding a custom config in GameData: 


@Kopernicus:FINAL
{
    %useOnDemandBiomes = false
}

I've tested this on my main savegame and it eliminated the freezing when switching between Flight and Map view! 

Thanks so much!

Always happy to help if I have a solution.

Edited September 27, 2019 by DeltaDizzy

Hello everyone,

I have the same problem but im a complete amateur. Could someone explain to me how you apply the fix?

I dont know how to create custom config files.

Thank you very much

On 9/29/2019 at 3:44 PM, Shanty said:

I don't know how to create custom config files.

You create a new file anywhere in your GameData directory and make sure it has CFG extension. If you are on windows, read this on how to enable extensions. Then open the file in text editor (Notepad, not Word)  and paste the text snippet.

45 minutes ago, Tomáš Brada said:

You create a new file anywhere in your GameData directory and make sure it has CFG extension. If you are on windows, read this on how to enable extensions. Then open the file in text editor (Notepad, not Word)  and paste the text snippet.

Thank you for your help!
It works! I love you guys!
